arabic_text: ٱقۡتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلۡقَمَرُ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1577]- This was a sign given by Allāh to Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) when the Quraysh challenged him to show them a miracle.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.54:1) Narrated Anas رضي الله عنه: The people of Makkah asked the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم to show them a sign (miracle). So he showed them (the miracle) of the cleaving of the moon. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.6, Hadîth No.390).

translations.english_saheeh: The Hour has come near, and the moon has split [in two].[1577]
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. The Hour has drawn near, and the moon has been cleft asunder (the people of Makkah requested Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم to show them a miracle, so he showed them the splitting of the moon).[2]
translations.english_rwwad: The Hour has drawn near and the moon has split asunder.

arabic_text: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ ءَايَةٗ يُعۡرِضُواْ وَيَقُولُواْ سِحۡرٞ مُّسۡتَمِرّٞ
phonetic: 54.2 Wa 'In Yaraw 'Āyatan Yu`riđū Wa Yaqūlū Siĥrun Mustamirrun

translations.english_saheeh: And if they see a sign [i.e., miracle], they turn away and say, "Passing magic."[1578]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And if they see a sign, they turn away, and say: "This is continuous magic."
translations.english_rwwad: Whenever they see a sign, they turn away and say, “Same old magic!”

arabic_text: وَكَذَّبُواْ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓاْ أَهۡوَآءَهُمۡۚ وَكُلُّ أَمۡرٖ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ
phonetic: 54.3 Wa Kadhabū Wa Attaba`ū 'Ahwā'ahum Wa Kullu 'Amrin Mustaqirrun

translations.english_saheeh: And they denied and followed their inclinations. But for every matter is a [time of] settlement.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They belied (the Verses of Allâh - this Qur’ân), and followed their own lusts. And every matter will be settled (according to the kind of deeds: good deeds will take their doers to Paradise, and similarly evil deeds will take their doers to Hell).
translations.english_rwwad: They deny [the truth] and follow their desires, but every matter will reach its inevitable end.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزۡدَجَرٌ
phonetic: 54.4 Wa Laqad Jā'ahum Mina Al-'Anbā'i Mā Fīhi Muzdajarun

translations.english_saheeh: And there has already come to them of information that in which there is deterrence.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed there has come to them news (in this Qur’ân) wherein there is (enough warning) to check (them from evil),
translations.english_rwwad: There have already come to them stories [of destroyed nations] that are sufficient to deter them,

arabic_text: حِكۡمَةُۢ بَٰلِغَةٞۖ فَمَا تُغۡنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ

translations.english_saheeh: Extensive wisdom - but warning does not avail [them].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Perfect wisdom (this Qur’ân), but (the preaching of) warners benefit them not.
translations.english_rwwad: which contain extensive wisdom, but the warnings are of no avail.

arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡۘ يَوۡمَ يَدۡعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ نُّكُرٍ
phonetic: 54.6 Fatawalla `Anhum Yawma Yad`u Ad-Dā`i 'Ilá Shay'in Nukurin

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1579]- Said to be an angel announcing the account and judgement.

translations.english_saheeh: So leave them, [O Muḥammad]. The Day the Caller[1579] calls to something forbidding,
translations.english_hilali_khan: So (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) withdraw from them. The Day that the caller will call (them) to a terrible thing.
translations.english_rwwad: So turn away from them [O Prophet]. On the Day when the caller will summon them to a horrific event,

arabic_text: خُشَّعًا أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمۡ جَرَادٞ مُّنتَشِرٞ
phonetic: 54.7 Khusha`āan 'Abşāruhum Yakhrujūna Mina Al-'Ajdāthi Ka'annahum Jarādun Muntashirun

translations.english_saheeh: Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,
translations.english_hilali_khan: 7. They will come forth, with humbled eyes from (their) graves as if they were locusts spread abroad,
translations.english_rwwad: with eyes downcast, they will come out of the graves like scattered locusts,

arabic_text: مُّهۡطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِۖ يَقُولُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوۡمٌ عَسِرٞ
phonetic: 54.8 Muhţi`īna 'Ilá Ad-Dā`i Yaqūlu Al-Kāfirūna Hādhā Yawmun `Asirun

translations.english_saheeh: Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Hastening towards the caller. The disbelievers will say: "This is a hard Day."
translations.english_rwwad: rushing headlong towards the caller. The disbelievers will say, “This is a hard Day!”

arabic_text: ۞ كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ فَكَذَّبُواْ عَبۡدَنَا وَقَالُواْ مَجۡنُونٞ وَٱزۡدُجِرَ
phonetic: 54.9 Kadhabat Qablahum Qawmu Nūĥin Fakadhabū `Abdanā Wa Qālū Majnūnun Wa Azdujira

translations.english_saheeh: The people of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant and said, "A madman," and he was repelled.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The people of Nûh (Noah) denied (their Messenger) before them. They rejected Our slave, and said: "A madman!" and he was insolently rebuked and threatened.
translations.english_rwwad: The people of Noah rejected [the truth] before them; they rejected Our slave and said, “He is a madman,” and he was rebuked.

arabic_text: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّي مَغۡلُوبٞ فَٱنتَصِرۡ

translations.english_saheeh: So he invoked his Lord, "Indeed, I am overpowered, so help."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he invoked his Lord (saying): "I have been overcome, so help (me)!"
translations.english_rwwad: So he called upon his Lord, “I am overpowered, so help me!”

arabic_text: فَفَتَحۡنَآ أَبۡوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٖ مُّنۡهَمِرٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Then We opened the gates of the heaven with rain pouring down
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We opened the gates of the heaven with water pouring forth.
translations.english_rwwad: So We opened the gates of the sky with water pouring down in torrents,

arabic_text: وَفَجَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ عُيُونٗا فَٱلۡتَقَى ٱلۡمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمۡرٖ قَدۡ قُدِرَ
phonetic: 54.12 Wa Fajjarnā Al-'Arđa `Uyūnāan Fāltaqá Al-Mā'u `Alá 'Amrin Qad Qudira

translations.english_saheeh: And caused the earth to burst with springs, and the waters met for a matter already predestined.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We caused springs to gush forth from the earth. So the waters (of the heaven and the earth) met for a matter predestined.
translations.english_rwwad: and We caused the earth to burst forth with springs, then the waters met for a preordained purpose.

arabic_text: وَحَمَلۡنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلۡوَٰحٖ وَدُسُرٖ

translations.english_saheeh: And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We carried him on a (ship) made of planks and nails,
translations.english_rwwad: We carried him on an [Ark made] of planks and nails,

arabic_text: تَجۡرِي بِأَعۡيُنِنَا جَزَآءٗ لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
phonetic: 54.14 Tajrī Bi'a`yuninā Jazā'an Liman Kāna Kufira

translations.english_saheeh: Sailing under Our observation as reward for he who had been denied.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Floating under Our Eyes: a reward for him who had been rejected!
translations.english_rwwad: sailing under Our [watchful] Eyes; as a reward for the one [they] denied.

arabic_text: وَلَقَد تَّرَكۡنَٰهَآ ءَايَةٗ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
phonetic: 54.15 Wa Laqad Taraknāhā 'Āyatan Fahal Min Muddakirin

translations.english_saheeh: And We left it as a sign, so is there any who will remember?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, We have left this as a sign. Then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
translations.english_rwwad: We have certainly left it as a sign; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1580]- To those after them, who were expected to derive a lesson from previous occurrences.

translations.english_saheeh: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.[1580]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?
translations.english_rwwad: Then how were My punishment and My warnings?

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
phonetic: 54.17 Wa Laqad Yassarnā Al-Qur'āna Lildhikri Fahal Min Muddakirin

translations.english_saheeh: And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We have indeed made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any one who will remember (or receive admonition)?
translations.english_rwwad: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ عَادٞ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translations.english_saheeh: ʿAad denied; and how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
translations.english_hilali_khan: ‘Âd (people) belied (their Prophet, Hûd); then how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?
translations.english_rwwad: ‘Ād disbelieved. Then how were My punishment and My warnings?

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ رِيحٗا صَرۡصَرٗا فِي يَوۡمِ نَحۡسٖ مُّسۡتَمِرّٖ
phonetic: 54.19 'Innā 'Arsalnā `Alayhim Rīĥāan Şarşarāan Fī Yawmi Naĥsin Mustamirrin

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We sent against them a furious wind of harsh voice on a day of evil omen and continuous calamity.
translations.english_rwwad: We sent against them a furious wind on a day of continuous misfortune,

arabic_text: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٖ مُّنقَعِرٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Extracting the people[1581] as if they were trunks of palm trees uprooted.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Plucking out men as if they were uprooted stems of date-palms.
translations.english_rwwad: sweeping people away, as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.

arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translations.english_saheeh: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?
translations.english_rwwad: Then how were My punishment and My warnings?

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
phonetic: 54.22 Wa Laqad Yassarnā Al-Qur'āna Lildhikri Fahal Min Muddakirin

translations.english_saheeh: And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We have indeed made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
translations.english_rwwad: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

translations.english_saheeh: Thamūd denied the warning.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thamûd (people also) belied the warnings.
translations.english_rwwad: Thamūd rejected the warnings,

arabic_text: فَقَالُوٓاْ أَبَشَرٗا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدٗا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذٗا لَّفِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٍ
phonetic: 54.24 Faqālū 'Abasharāan Minnā Wāĥidāan Nattabi`uhu 'Innā 'Idhāan Lafī Đalālin Wa Su`urin

translations.english_saheeh: And said, "Is it one human being[1582] among us that we should follow? Indeed, we would then be in error and madness.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they said: "A man, alone among us - shall we follow him? Truly then we should be in error and distress (or madness)!"
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Shall we follow a single human being from among us? Then we would surely be in error and insanity!

arabic_text: أَءُلۡقِيَ ٱلذِّكۡرُ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۢ بَيۡنِنَا بَلۡ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٞ
phonetic: 54.25 'A'uulqiya Adh-Dhikru `Alayhi Min Bayninā Bal Huwa Kadhābun 'Ashirun

translations.english_saheeh: Has the message been sent down upon him from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Is it that the Reminder is sent to him [Prophet Sâlih عليه السلام] alone from among us? Nay, he is an insolent liar!"
translations.english_rwwad: Has the revelation been sent down upon him out of all of us? Rather, he is an insolent liar.”

arabic_text: سَيَعۡلَمُونَ غَدٗا مَّنِ ٱلۡكَذَّابُ ٱلۡأَشِرُ

translations.english_saheeh: They will know tomorrow who is the insolent liar.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Tomorrow they will come to know who is the liar, the insolent one!
translations.english_rwwad: Tomorrow they will know who the insolent liar is.

arabic_text: إِنَّا مُرۡسِلُواْ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتۡنَةٗ لَّهُمۡ فَٱرۡتَقِبۡهُمۡ وَٱصۡطَبِرۡ
phonetic: 54.27 'Innā Mursilū An-Nāqati Fitnatan Lahum Fārtaqibhum Wa Aşţabir

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1583]- This and the following verse are an address to Ṣāliḥ (upon him be peace).

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as trial for them, so watch them and be patient.[1583]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We are sending the she-camel as a test for them. So watch them [O Sâlih عليه السلام], and be patient!
translations.english_rwwad: We are sending the she-camel as a test for them, so watch them [O Sālih] and be patient,

arabic_text: وَنَبِّئۡهُمۡ أَنَّ ٱلۡمَآءَ قِسۡمَةُۢ بَيۡنَهُمۡۖ كُلُّ شِرۡبٖ مُّحۡتَضَرٞ
phonetic: 54.28 Wa Nabbi'hum 'Anna Al-Mā'a Qismatun Baynahum Kullu Shirbin Muĥtađarun

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1584]- i.e., between the tribe of Thamūd and the she-camel - a day for each to drink.

translations.english_saheeh: And inform them that the water is shared between them,[1584] each [day of] drink attended [by turn].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And inform them that the water is to be shared between (her and) them, each one’s right to drink being established (by turns).
translations.english_rwwad: and tell them that the water is to be shared between them; each should take its drink in turn.

arabic_text: فَنَادَوۡاْ صَاحِبَهُمۡ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1585]- i.e., the worst and most despicable among them.
[1586]- Or "he took," referring to his sword or to the she-camel.

translations.english_saheeh: But they called their companion,[1585] and he dared[1586] and hamstrung [her].
translations.english_hilali_khan: But they called their comrade and he took (a sword) and killed (her).
translations.english_rwwad: But they called their companion, and he undertook the task and hamstrung her.

arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translations.english_saheeh: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then, how (terrible) was My Torment and My Warnings?
translations.english_rwwad: Then how were My punishment and My warnings!

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَكَانُواْ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلۡمُحۡتَظِرِ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We sent upon them one shriek [i.e., blast from the sky], and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We sent against them a single Saihah (torment - awful cry), and they became like the stubble of a fold-builder.
translations.english_rwwad: We sent against them a single blast, leaving them like trampled hedge-building twigs.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
phonetic: 54.32 Wa Laqad Yassarnā Al-Qur'āna Lildhikri Fahal Min Muddakirin

translations.english_saheeh: And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, We have made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
translations.english_rwwad: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ قَوۡمُ لُوطِۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

translations.english_saheeh: The people of Lot denied the warning.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The people of Lût (Lot) belied the warnings.
translations.english_rwwad: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٖۖ نَّجَّيۡنَٰهُم بِسَحَرٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except the family of Lot - We saved them before dawn.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We sent against them a violent storm of stones (which destroyed them all), except the family of Lût (Lot), them We saved in the last hour of the night,
translations.english_rwwad: We sent against them a storm of pebbles, except the family of Lot whom We saved before dawn,

arabic_text: نِّعۡمَةٗ مِّنۡ عِندِنَاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي مَن شَكَرَ
phonetic: 54.35 Ni`matan Min `Indinā Kadhālika Najzī Man Shakara

translations.english_saheeh: As favor from Us. Thus do We reward he who is grateful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: As a Favour from Us. Thus do We reward him who gives thanks (by obeying Us).
translations.english_rwwad: as a blessing from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَنذَرَهُم بَطۡشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوۡاْ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

translations.english_saheeh: And he had already warned them of Our assault, but they disputed the warning.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And he [Lût (Lot)] indeed had warned them of Our Seizure (punishment), but they did doubt the warnings!
translations.english_rwwad: He had already warned them of Our punishing assault, but they doubted the warnings.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيۡفِهِۦ فَطَمَسۡنَآ أَعۡيُنَهُمۡ فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
phonetic: 54.37 Wa Laqad Rāwadūhu `An Đayfihi Faţamasnā 'A`yunahum Fadhūqū `Adhābī Wa Nudhuri

translations.english_saheeh: And they had demanded from him his guests, but We obliterated their eyes, [saying], "Taste My punishment and warning."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they indeed sought to shame his guest (by asking to commit sodomy with them). So We blinded their eyes, (saying) "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."
translations.english_rwwad: They even demanded that he let them have their way with his angel-guests, so We blinded their eyes, [saying], “Taste My punishment and My warnings!”

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ صَبَّحَهُم بُكۡرَةً عَذَابٞ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ

translations.english_saheeh: And there came upon them by morning an abiding punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, an abiding torment seized them early in the morning.
translations.english_rwwad: By the early morning a lasting torment overtook them.

arabic_text: فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

translations.english_saheeh: So taste My punishment and warning.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."
translations.english_rwwad: Taste My punishment and My warnings!

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
phonetic: 54.40 Wa Laqad Yassarnā Al-Qur'āna Lildhikri Fahal Min Muddakirin

translations.english_saheeh: And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, We have made the Qur’ân easy to understand and remember; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
translations.english_rwwad: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ

translations.english_saheeh: And there certainly came to the people of Pharaoh warning.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, warnings came to the people of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) [through Mûsâ (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron)].
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, warnings came to the people of Pharaoh.

arabic_text: كَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُمۡ أَخۡذَ عَزِيزٖ مُّقۡتَدِرٍ

translations.english_saheeh: They denied Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (They) belied all Our Signs, so We seized them with a Seizure of the All-Mighty, All-Capable (Omnipotent).
translations.english_rwwad: But they rejected all of Our signs, so We seized them with the grip of the All-Mighty, Most Powerful.

arabic_text: أَكُفَّارُكُمۡ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أُوْلَٰٓئِكُمۡ أَمۡ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٞ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ
phonetic: 54.43 'Akuffārukum Khayrun Min 'Ūla'ikum 'Am Lakum Barā'atun Fī Az-Zuburi

translations.english_saheeh: Are your disbelievers better than those [former ones], or have you immunity in the scriptures?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Are your disbelievers (O Quraish!) better than these [nations of Nûh (Noah), Lût (Lot), Sâlih, and the people of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) who were destroyed)? Or have you an immunity (against Our Torment) in the Divine Scriptures?
translations.english_rwwad: Are your disbelievers [O Makkans] superior than those, or have you been granted immunity in divine Scriptures?

arabic_text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ نَحۡنُ جَمِيعٞ مُّنتَصِرٞ

translations.english_saheeh: Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or say they: "We are a great multitude, victorious?"
translations.english_rwwad: Or do they say, “We are a united front, bound to prevail.”?

arabic_text: سَيُهۡزَمُ ٱلۡجَمۡعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1587]- This foretold event took place on the day of Badr.

translations.english_saheeh: [Their] assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in retreat].[1587]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Their multitude will be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
translations.english_rwwad: Soon their united front will be defeated, and they will flee.

arabic_text: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوۡعِدُهُمۡ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدۡهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
phonetic: 54.46 Bali As-Sā`atu Maw`iduhum Wa As-Sā`atu 'Ad/há Wa 'Amarru

translations.english_saheeh: But the Hour is their appointment [for due punishment], and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, but the Hour is their appointed time (for their full recompense), and the Hour will be more grievous and more bitter.
translations.english_rwwad: But the Hour is their appointed time, and the Hour is more catastrophic and more bitter.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness.[1588].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily the Mujrimûn (polytheists, disbelievers, sinners, criminals) are in error (in this world) and will burn (in the Hell-fire in the Hereafter).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the wicked are in error and will be in blazes.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يُسۡحَبُونَ فِي ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمۡ ذُوقُواْ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
phonetic: 54.48 Yawma Yusĥabūna Fī An-Nāri `Alá Wujūhihim Dhūqū Massa Saqara

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1589]- One of the proper names of Hell.

translations.english_saheeh: The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces [it will be said], "Taste the touch of Saqar."[1589]
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day they will be dragged on their faces into the Fire (it will be said to them): "Taste you the touch of Hell!"[1]
translations.english_rwwad: On the Day when they will be dragged into the Fire on their faces, [they will be told], “Taste the agony of Hell!”

arabic_text: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَٰهُ بِقَدَرٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, all things We created with predestination.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, We have created all things with Qadar (Divine Preordainments of all things before their creation as written in the Book of Decrees Al-Lauh Al-Mahfûz).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We have created everything according to a determined measure.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَمۡرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٞ كَلَمۡحِۭ بِٱلۡبَصَرِ

translations.english_saheeh: And Our command is but one, like a glance of the eye.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Our Commandment is but one as the twinkling of an eye.
translations.english_rwwad: Our command is but a single word, which is fulfilled in the blink of an eye.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَآ أَشۡيَاعَكُمۡ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1590]- i.e., those similar to you in attitude and behavior when they rejected Allāh's messengers.

translations.english_saheeh: And We have already destroyed your kinds,[1590] so is there any who will remember?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed, We have destroyed your likes; then is there any that will remember (or receive admonition)?
translations.english_rwwad: We have destroyed many like you [O Makkans]; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: وَكُلُّ شَيۡءٖ فَعَلُوهُ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ
phonetic: 54.52 Wa Kullu Shay'in Fa`alūhu Fī Az-Zuburi

translations.english_saheeh: And everything they did is in written records.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And everything they have done is noted in (their) Records (of deeds).
translations.english_rwwad: Everything they did is in the written records,

arabic_text: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٖ وَكَبِيرٖ مُّسۡتَطَرٌ
phonetic: 54.53 Wa Kullu Şaghīrin Wa Kabīrin Mustaţarun

translations.english_saheeh: And every small and great [thing] is inscribed.
translations.english_hilali_khan: and its footnote).
translations.english_rwwad: and everything, small or big, is written down.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَهَرٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, The Muttaqûn (the pious - see V.2:2), will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers (Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and rivers,

arabic_text: فِي مَقۡعَدِ صِدۡقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٖ مُّقۡتَدِرِۭ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1591]- Who accomplishes whatever He wills whenever He wills.

translations.english_saheeh: In a seat of honor near a Sovereign, Perfect in Ability.[1591]
translations.english_hilali_khan: In a seat of truth (i.e. Paradise), near the Omnipotent King (Allâh, the One, the All-Blessed, the Most High, the Owner of Majesty and Honour).
translations.english_rwwad: seated in honor in the presence of the Most Powerful Sovereign.
